name: untilyouaresonude
text: A comment left by untilyouaresonude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by goocifer, darren_cuddy, Zem, motts)

name: spinynorman
text:
The mystic art at the end really is great. It summarizes the debauched holiness one feels after a really solid, enjoyable bender.

One night me and my two friends drank two bottles of Powers and took some wine into the apartment building next door that was being torn down. It was like drinking in Kosovo or in the crumbling ribs of some apocalyptic city. It was great, though. Just look at the last panel to this strip and you'll know what it was like.

name: shineboxx
text: 'Debauched holiness' is probably the best phrase I've heard all day. Granted it's only nine am, but I've got the feeling it'll hold up.

name: pogo
text: A comment left by pogo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by apocowarg, sean1058, robotrodeo, NDCaesar, Aki, twohats, PoodleLucy)

name: spinynorman
text: Who says I overindulged? I was engaged in a spiritual pilgrimage through greasy back alleys and moonlit urban ruins. I had a purpose , man. That was a journey.

name: pogo
text: A comment left by pogo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Spoon, mercuri0us, NDCaesar)

name: woodenteeth
text: The judge is sympathetic if you got laid.

name: laserblade
text: Unless you're being tried for rape.

name: likeiwassaying
text: this describes achewood in a better way than i have ever heard.

name: rhadamanthus
text: 'and Dean, holy'

name: spinynorman
text: Huh?

name: rhadamanthus
text: On the Road, man. Dean Moriarty (Neal Cassidy), the Holy Goof, embodies this feeling you describe so well.

name: gusplease
text: A comment left by gusplease was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, biomusicologist, djwhiterabbit, hellofyellin, fallow_fields, NeoNaoNeo, KingPete, HSE, mortshire, chaesar, Wulvaine, dropkickpikachu, stormagnet)

name: catachresis
text: "Losing It In A-minor" is going to be the name of my first album

name: closefriend
text:
You're just reacting to the initial shock of seeing Ray lost in the Time Cube.

We all know that REAL MEN put their songs in non-piano-friendly keys like G#m or Bbm.

name: senseihollywood
text:
my friend, your comment disregards the last 60 years of popular music...

ain't no real man gonna play in Bb minor...

actually, if you are singing in G# or Bbm you are probably a Lesbian with a capo...

...if you are a man playing the piano then you have sold your soul to the Dark Lord.


I have gathered much empirical data to support this hypothesis.

name: juanclaudius
text: Daniel Johnston never did sell his soul and he was the king of them black-and-white keys

name: flipconstantine
text: i'm not so sure about that one, he definitely had some conversations with satan.  maybe no concrete deals were made, but satan was a major bidder.

name: stagnantdisplay
text: Daniel Johnston AND Jandek? You are awesome.

name: poodlelucy
text: kudos for being musically educated.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: a album title that i made for a terrible Garageband song was 'A Series Of Mistakes Near Or Around 3/4 Time.'

name: nolley
text: "Alas, I think I am becoming a god." ~Vespasian~

name: aperson
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: senseihollywood
text: if this isn't a Leonard Cohen song, it oughta be...

name: killerlimpet
text: Fingerpicking acoustic, "Suzanne" era Cohen, or techno-y, 80s "First We Take Manhattan" Cohen?

name: rowboat
text: Definitely the latter. With backing vocals by David Byrne.

name: snowman
text: Whoa, man.

name: expellens
text: Leonard Cohen: One man, One Casio.  I now dig that dogg, but when I first started listening, I would think he sounded like Leon Redbone having fun at the music store in the keyboard section.

name: ellameno
text: Reading this one through again, I immediately thought of it put to the tune of Desolation Row by Bob Dylan and it fit surprisingly well.

name: whattorso
text:
Yo, s'like poetry.

Syntax is nice nice

name: sargasm
text: Say "Zero degrees Celsius" while wearing a sock over your dong

name: semiquaver
text: Tried it.  Wasn't fun.

name: catgrl131
text: Have you tried it.... my way?

name: riazm
text:
Sock fell off after "Zero Degrees"

Can I reharden and start from Celsius? Or do I have to start the whole thing again, please advise.

name: semiquaver
text: You must start from the top.  Few of us will assist you in this process.

name: riazm
text:
I was really worried whilst leaving this comment. I feared people would deride me for not being able to wear a sock without rigidity.

But you know what? Life's too fucking short, maybe if I put a sock over my flacid penis it'll immediately fall off. So what? It doesn't make me any less of a man.

And I'm ok with that.

name: semiquaver
text: Why not drink more?

name: farqussus
text: Put it over your balls too. That's the trick.

name: i_love_kate
text: Acheworld: Practical advice for the modern thinker.

name: semiquaver
text: We aim to please, and we're not liable for death or injury if we miss and hit something vital!

name: mangtastic
text: Giving this comment a chubby feels kinda meta.

name: stuart
text: Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John. Now, if I could only sing Search and Destroy on key I'd have life laid out for me.

name: zedpower
text: Luke and Mark weren't apostles, though.

name: stuart
text: ...Judas.

name: straw
text: Peter, Simon, Thomas, Paul, John, Matthew... ahh, bible school learning was incomplete at best!

name: laikalost
text:
Peter, Paul, & Mary? They sang songs about magical dragons.

And they went on adventures... with Jesus.

name: comrade_tom
text: Thaddeus, anyone?

name: farqussus
text: Don't mind if I do

name: cpnglxynchos
text: hilarious.

name: cdl146
text: Man, what was in those fingernails?

name: thesyndicate88
text: George Clinton is for sure familiar with fingernail schnapps.

name: pitseleh
text: I really think that the Charleston should have been involved in this strip. But then again, I imagine it would be hard to do in a suit made of newspapers.

name: madnes
text: *crinkle thwup shrip*

name: mshendry
text: where'd he find a typewriter?

name: riazm
text: Germany

name: pogo
text: Yeah, rappin' on a London street wearing a newspaper suit, starving and delusional, I've almost done that.

name: canusdivinus
text: Not London! Berlin! READ DAMN YOU.

name: pogo
text: Fine, but I've only been to London.

name: crankheart
text: why does this distinctly remind me of saul williams?

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
first time i've said it...

this needs to be rated higher.

name: aargh
text: A rough sketch. Too much distortion? Opinions please, people.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: good amount of distortion, though possibly a tad too harsh. I imagine the vocals would be more sing-songy, like what you do when you're drunk and rowdy. But on the right track.

name: redmange
text: I gave this a five.  I gave it a five because "Station to Station" reminds me of Bowie, whether it is intentional or not.  Please don't inform me if it is just a common phrase to say, I do not want to feel any different.
